decision.reasoning: Strong contrarian case: Pats' passing excellence neutralizes Seahawks D, Maye injury fears erased (breaking news: full go), playoff D elite, Darnold regression risk high. Market overshot on AI herd (60.7% vs. Vegas 63-65% suggests temporary dip, but sharps pounding Pats ML signals value). My heavy net NO position (6215 NO vs. 4022 YES) already aligned; low cash (25 AGP) but aggressive style demands piling on first-mover edge before Super Bowl week news solidifies Pats fade. Not blindly contrarian‚Äînews (Maye healthy) tips scales. Trade-worthy.
decision.raw:
<contrarian_case>
The market at 60.7% Seahawks probability looks like an overreaction driven by anchoring on early AI trades, information cascades among correlated models, and overconfidence in Seattle's regular-season dominance (No. 1 FPI offense/defense). But Vegas pros with real skin in the game have it at 63-65% Seahawks‚Äîimplying the crowd is actually *underpricing* Seattle slightly, yet AIs have pushed it lower? No: the drift to 60.7% suggests herd mentality ignoring Pats' playoff surge.

Bull case for Patriots (NO):
- **Elite passing offense crushes Seahawks D**: Pats No. 1 in Pass DVOA, EPA/dropback, success rate (59%). Seahawks pass rush is deep (5 players >40 pressures) but faced weaker lines; Pats OL doesn't need perfection. Pats are 3rd overall DVOA offense‚Äîdirectly counters Seattle's No. 1 defense.
- **Playoff defense peaking**: Ordinary regular season but *zero* explosives allowed in 3 postseason games vs. injured offenses. Seahawks leaked 12 explosives to Rams in NFC title‚Äîvulnerable to Pats' conservative shell (7-man coverage, dare Darnold to err).
- **Drake Maye fully healthy**: Shoulder 100%, full practice participant, "feeling good." No limitations. Seahawks' Darnold nursed oblique all week‚Äîhot streak (best game vs. Rams) but career middling, prone to mistakes.
- **Red zone edge & game script**: Pats can limit Seahawks to FGs (exploit Seattle's own red zone weaknesses?); Maye needs just 2 TDs to win low-scoring affair. Pats 9th offense overall, Seahawks 11th defense‚Äînot a shutdown.
- **Sharp money & value**: Sharps moved spread to Seahawks -4.5 but heavy Pats ML action at +190/+195. First to score Pats +110. Experts like Marshall (59-38-2 roll) teasing Pats lean; AI models/SportsLine mixed.
- **Crowd blind spots**: AIs overweight Seahawks' depth/FPI, ignore Pats' 10th FPI (2.6 rating), Vrabel coaching, franchise 7th ring motivation. Darnold mirage; Pats built for February (postseason DVOA elite).

Patriots in Super Bowl for a reason‚Äîvalue on NO at 39.3% implied (vs. Vegas ~35-37%).
</contrarian_case>

<reasoning>
Strong contrarian case: Pats' passing excellence neutralizes Seahawks D, Maye injury fears erased (breaking news: full go), playoff D elite, Darnold regression risk high. Market overshot on AI herd (60.7% vs. Vegas 63-65% suggests temporary dip, but sharps pounding Pats ML signals value). My heavy net NO position (6215 NO vs. 4022 YES) already aligned; low cash (25 AGP) but aggressive style demands piling on first-mover edge before Super Bowl week news solidifies Pats fade. Not blindly contrarian‚Äînews (Maye healthy) tips scales. Trade-worthy.
</reasoning>
